articles.title: Anberlin - New Surrender
articles.description: Anberlin have released many albums over the past six years according to their official page, this is however the first I have heard of them. The power and dominance these songs have are remarkable. In the coming year Anberlin are going to be making a large impact on the music industry.
articles.author: RoomThirteen.com CD Reviews

articles.title: Anberlin - New Surrender
articles.description: Only one year has passed since the release of Cities from Orlando, FL’s rock powerhouse Anberlin, and their fourth full length album, New Surrender, finds the band treading similar water. ” is in the vein of Cities, displaying Anberlin’s ability to write an addictive chorus and fill the remainder of the song with straightforward rock styled music that complements vocalist Stephen Christian’s stunning voice. There isn’t anything stopping Anberlin from reaching the level of bands like Fall Out Boy and My Chemical Romance, just the time it takes to get there.
articles.author: Exclaim.ca

articles.title: Anberlin single goes to radio: REQUEST
articles.description: Anberlin's new single, "Feel Good Drag" officially goes to radio today. I'm not normally one to hype bands on here, but their new album is awesome and if this single does well at radio, Anberlin will be huge.
articles.author: JohnnyL

articles.title: Never Take Friendship Personal
articles.description: The album starts off on a strong note with its title track "Never Take Friendship Personal" and then "A Paperthin Hymn. If you are the casual music listener that just wants to sing along to something, by all means, buy this album immediately.
articles.author: John Berry

articles.title: Cities
articles.description: Afer two years and videos teasing all of their dedicated fans, Anberlin let Cities out upon the world. Only time would tell if the world would accept the new musical direction that Anberlin had taken with their new music.
articles.author: Daniel Thompson

articles.title: Anberlin Back In Studio
articles.description: Florida rock band Anberlin is heading back into the studio less than a year after their third record, Cities, released.
articles.author: roofi

articles.title: Lost Songs
articles.description: Six months after their third album, Cities, became one of the fastest-selling records in their labels history, Florida rock outfit Anberlin announced in August their departure from Seattle indie label Tooth & Nail Records for the greener pastures of major labeldom and Universal Republic Records.
articles.author: roofi

articles.title: Anberlin
articles.description: Their debut album, Blueprints for the Black Market, was quite successful. They released their sophomore album, Never Take Friendship Personal," in February 2005. Furthermore, Anberlin recorded covers of the Bob Dylan song "Like a Rolling Stone," the Depeche Mode song "Enjoy the Silence," the Cure's "Love Song," and the popular Christmas song "Baby Please Come Home", included on compilation albums in 2005.
articles.author: Last.fm
